title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Marcos at the White House
description: Also, Russian attacks across Ukraine.

title: In Israel, McCarthy Pledges Continued Support for Ukraine
description: The speaker, who warned last year that with Republicans in control of the House there would be no “blank check” for Ukraine, told a Russian reporter he would continue support to Kyiv against Russia’s invasion.

title: McCarthy Offers to Host Netanyahu in Washington After Biden Refuses
description: The House speaker, Kevin McCarthy, made the informal invitation during a visit to the Israeli Parliament, which came after President Biden had declined to invite the Israeli leader to Washington.

title: Keshub Mahindra, Billionaire Indian Industrialist, Dies at 99
description: He expanded a family steel and jeep business into an international leviathan, but his career was stained by a conviction in the 1984 Bhopal disaster.

title: U.S.-Philippines Alliance Grows With Biden and Marcos Meeting: What to Know
description: President Biden is meeting President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. of the Philippines at the White House, a sign of strengthening ties between the two countries. Here’s what you need to know.

title: A Dutch Quest for Buried Nazi Treasure Comes Up Empty
description: The release of a map sketched by a German soldier had touched off a gold rush in a tiny village, but an early-morning excavation failed to solve the mystery.

title: Thousands Flee to Sudan’s Main Seaport, Seeking Ships to Safety
description: Port Sudan, on the Red Sea, has been overwhelmed by people fleeing the violence and scrambling to join an evacuation to Saudi Arabia.

title: A.I. Is Getting Better at Mind-Reading
description: In a recent experiment, researchers used large language models to translate brain activity into words.

title: Biden to Meet Marcos in Washington as Tensions Grow With China
description: The Filipino leader’s four-day visit is meant to send a message to China amid conflict over Taiwan and the South China Sea.

title: The Mud Stands in the Way of a Ukrainian Counteroffensive
description: The unusually wet ground is one obstacle that the Ukrainian military, for all of its ingenuity, is finding difficult to overcome as it prepares for a counteroffensive against Russian forces.

title: Battlefield Update: Russia and Ukraine Both Claim Gains in Bakhmut
description: The fight for Bakhmut, the ruined city in eastern Ukraine, has become a focal point of the war as both sides have poured troops into battle and sustained heavy casualties.

title: Explosion Derails Freight Train in Bryansk Region of Russia, Local Official Says
description: The blast was the latest in a spate of apparent attacks to hit the area bordering Ukraine.

title: Defending press freedom, an eye on China and more on Ukraine’s grain: What to watch for this week.
Russia Launches Another Aerial Assault as Fighting Intensifies
description: Air defenses shot down most Russian cruise missiles launched early Monday, as Ukrainian forces stepped up efforts to strike Russian targets behind the front lines.

title: Anger Over Pensions Law Fuels May Day Protests in France
description: Protesters are still hoping to force the government to reverse its decision to raise the legal retirement age from 62 to 64.

title: Woman Charged With 9 Murders in Series of Mysterious Deaths in Thailand
description: The police said they found the suspect, 36, with cyanide after the sudden death of a friend with whom she was traveling.

title: The Hard Question of Affirmative Action and Slavery
description: If there were an affirmative action program for the descendants of enslaved people, would you consider that to be race-based?

title: In Transylvania, Anyone With $200 Can Live Like a King. (Well, One Specific King.)
description: Just don’t expect luxury at the Prince of Wales Guesthouse, where the surrounding forest is the main draw.

title: Scotland’s Coronation Day: Charles Souvenirs, Anti-Monarchy Rallies and Shrugs
description: The crowning of King Charles III will be a test of sentiment about the monarchy in Scotland, where many supporters of independence see the royals as part of the Britain they want to leave behind.

title: Alireza Akbari, the Iranian Insider and British Spy Executed in Iran
description: In January, Iran executed a former senior official who provided Britain with valuable intelligence on Iranian nuclear and military programs over a decade, according to Western intelligence officials.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Sudan’s health system on the brink.

title: Paraguay Voters Elect Conservative Economist as President
description: The election of Santiago Peña keeps the right-wing Colorado Party in control of Paraguay, which it has run for all but five of the past 76 years.
